metadata.Title: CVE-2017-1002150 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
python-fedora 0.8.0 and lower is vulnerable to an open redirect resulting in loss of CSRF protection

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-1002150` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-fedora - 0.9.0-1
python3-fedora - 0.9.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python-fedora package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.9.0-1').
